We must act now to avoid catastrophic climate change
Long term, climate change is a bigger threat to our security than anything the NSA or CIA address today.
Those are the basics of climate change. In a few tweets.
That's the last number you need to know, and the most important. It's the safety zone for planet earth.
The world's leading climate scientists have now revised the highest safe level of CO2 to 350 parts per million. So we need to cut carbon.
Along with extreme weather, these impacts are combining to exacerbate conflicts and security issues in already resource-strapped regions.
The oceans are growing more acidic because of the CO2 they are absorbing, which makes it harder for animals...
(yes, I am cutting and pasting. Credit to http://t.co/0razEhS0up for the content)
If that happens, many of the world's cities, island nations, and farmland will be underwater.
Sea levels have begun to rise, and scientists warn that they could go up as much as several meters this century.
Drought is becoming much more common, making food harder to grow in many places.
Mosquitoes, who like a warmer world, are spreading into lots of new places, and bringing malaria and dengue fever with them.
Glaciers everywhere are melting and disappearing fast‚Äîand they are a source of drinking water for hundreds of millions of people.
Scientists are now saying that's too much ‚Äì we're already beginning to see disastrous impacts in our climate and our planet.
By now, and this is the second number, the planet has about 400 parts per million CO2 ‚Äì and this number is rising every year. (+2ppm)
Since the beginning of human civilization up until about 200 years ago, our atmosphere contained about 275 parts per million of CO2
There are three numbers you need to really understand global warming: 275, 400, and 350.
We urgently need to transition off of dirty energy in order to avoid catastrophic climate change
